name: found
trans: to establish something

name: band
trans: a group of people who have joined together for a special purpose, or a group of animals

name: trainer
trans: a person who teaches skills to people or animals to prepare them for a job, activity, or sport

name: entertainment
trans: public shows, performances, or other ways of enjoying yourself

name: century
trans: a period of 100 years

name: ancient
trans: of or from a very long time ago

name: venue
trans: the place where a public event or meeting happens

name: popular
trans: liked, enjoyed, or admired by many people or by most people in a particular group

name: spectator
trans: a person who watches an activity, esp. a public event, without taking part

name: exhibit
trans: to show something in public for competition, sale, or amusement

name: exotic
trans: unusual and specially interesting because of coming from a country that is far away

name: renovation
trans: the process of repairing and improving a building so that it is in good condition again, or the improvements that are carried out

name: massive
trans: very large in size, amount, or degree

name: remnant
trans: a small piece or amount of something that is left from a larger, original piece or amount

name: Permanently
trans: always and for ever

name: reduce
trans: to make something less in size, amount, degree, importance, or price

name: develop
trans: to grow or cause to grow or change into a more advanced form

name: talent
trans: a special natural ability to do something well, or people who have this ability

name: survive
trans: to continue to live or to exist, esp. after a dangerous event

name: grandeur
trans: a quality of great beauty and size which attracts admiration
